author: @teletica7
title: Ejército israelí dice haber lanzado “ataque de precisión” contra Beirut | Teletica
text: Deutsche Welle Ejército israelí dice haber lanzado “ataque de precisión” contra Beirut Los bombardeos han dejado más de 600 muertos, más de un millar de heridos, y más de 90.000 desplazados, confirmó la ONU. [ Deutsche Welle ](/autor/deutsche-welle_1184) 26/9/2024 17:05 El Ejército israelí dijo haber lanzado un “ataque de precisión” contra Beirut este jueves (26.09.2024), en un breve comunicado, sin ofrecer más detalles por el momento. Se trata del cuarto bombardeo israelí contra la capital libanesa en menos de siete días y el sexto desde el inicio de los enfrentamientos entre Israel y el grupo chií Hezbolá, aliado de Irán, hace ya casi un año. La agencia de noticias libanesa (NNA), por su parte, confirmó el ataque de la aviación israelí, con tres misiles que impactaron contra un apartamento en un edificio residencial en el Dahye, los suburbios del sur de Beirut que son un bastión del grupo libanés que es considerado como terrorista por la Unión Europea y diversos países occidentales. Según la prensa israelí, el objetivo de este nuevo bombardeo israelí era el comandante de las fuerzas aéreas de Hezbolá, encargado, entre otras cosas, del programa de drones del grupo. El viernes pasado Israel también atacó otro edificio en el Dahye, dejando al menos 54 muertos, entre ellos varios altos mandos de los chiíes. Más de 600 muertos Desde este lunes, las fuerzas israelíes están llevando a cabo una campaña de bombardeos masivos, especialmente en el sur y este de Líbano, que ya han dejado más de 600 muertos, más de un millar de heridos, y más de 90.000 desplazados, confirmó ayer la ONU. El primer ministro israelí, Benjamín Netanyahu, rechazó este jueves la propuesta de un alto el fuego de 21 días en la línea divisoria de ambos países promovida por Estados Unidos y Francia, entre otros países, y advirtió de que los combates continuarán “con toda su fuerza”. Este mismo jueves, la Brigada Séptima del Ejército, desplegada en la frontera norte, concluyó una serie de ejercicios simulando una ofensiva contra territorio libanés, según un comunicado castrense. El Ejército dijo ayer estar preparándose para iniciar una posible invasión si llega la orden de Netanyahu, quien este jueves viajó a Nueva York para participar en la Asamblea General de la ONU. En previos ataques selectivos contra Beirut, Israel acabó en enero con la vida del número dos de la oficina política de Hamás, Saleh al Arouri, y en julio con la del jefe militar de Hezbolá, Fuad Shukr.

author: Beast Watch News
title: More than 40000 Palestinians have been killed in Gaza, the territory’s Health Ministry says
text:
DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip – More than 40,000 Palestinians have been killed in the Israel-Hamas war in Gaza, the territory’s Health Ministry said Thursday.
Israel’s offensive has also wounded 92,401 people and displaced over 85% of the population from their homes, the
ministry in Hamas-run Gaza said. It does not distinguish between civilians and militants in its toll.
The announcement came during yet another push from international mediators to broker a cease-fire in the war, now in its 11th month.
The conflict began Oct. 7 after Hamas-led militants attacked southern Israel, killing some 1,200 people — most of them civilians — and dragging roughly 250 hostages to Gaza.
Israel says 111 of the captives have not been released, including the bodies of 39. The hostages include 15 women and two children under the age of 5.
In Gaza, health officials have
struggled to fully identify the dead as bodies stream into overwhelmed hospitals and morgues where they say the count is compiled amid the chaos of war and displacement.
In its most recent detailed
report on the dead, issued Thursday, the ministry said 40,005 people have been killed. Health officials and civil defense workers say the true toll is likely thousands higher, since many bodies remain buried under the rubble of buildings destroyed in airstrikes.
Israel’s air and ground offensive in Gaza has been one of the
most devastating military campaigns in recent history.
The bombardment and shelling have killed
entire Palestinian families. With cemeteries often unreachable, families fleeing Israeli airstrikes bury their dead wherever possible — in backyards, along roadsides and under the staircases of their homes.
Israel says it aims to eliminate Hamas. It blames Hamas for civilian deaths because militants operate in civilian areas and have built extensive tunnel networks underneath them. Israeli forces have regularly targeted
mosques, schools, hospitals and cemeteries where it claims fighters or tunnels are located, often causing civilian casualties.
The fighting has also killed 329 Israeli soldiers. The Israeli military claims around 15,000 Hamas fighters are among those killed in Gaza but has not provided evidence.
Nearly 85% of Gaza’s 2.3 million people have been driven from their homes, fleeing multiple times across the territory to escape ground offensives. During the war, thousands within Israel and in southern Lebanon have also been displaced.
The assault has created a massive humanitarian crisis in Gaza. The entire territory is at high risk of famine and over 495,000 people — more than a fifth of the population — are expected to experience the most severe level of hunger in the next months, according to the
latest report by the leading authority on measuring hunger.
Sanitation systems have been destroyed, leaving
pools of sewage and towers of garbage in tent camps packed with displaced families.
The offensive likely either damaged or destroyed 59% of all structures in Gaza by July 3, including 70% of buildings in north Gaza, according to an analysis of satellite data by Corey Scher and Jamon Van Den Hoek, experts in mapping damage during war.
The conflict has sparked fears of a wider regional war, with Lebanon’s Hezbollah and the Israeli military trading fire almost daily over their countries’ border.
More than 500 people have been killed on the Lebanese side, including some 350 Hezbollah members and 50 fighters from other militant groups, with the rest civilians. In Israel, 22 soldiers and 24 civilians have been killed.
Frankel reported from Jerusalem.

author: israel garcía
title: ¡Se hará justicia! Caen hombres colombianos que robaron la casa de Miguel Bosé en CDMX
text: ¡Se hará justicia! Caen hombres colombianos que robaron la casa de Miguel Bosé en CDMX [Israel García](/autor/-/meta/israel-garcia) Los detenidos eran perseguidos desde hace meses por las autoridades, ya que operaban en 8 estados más En redes sociales comenzó a circular el video de una detención de varios hombres en pleno periférico de la Ciudad de México llamó la atención. Tras horas de lo sucedido se confirmó que los presuntos delincuentes estarían involucrados en robos de varios domicilios, entre ellos del artista español Miguel Bosé. Desde Milenio y Radio Fórmula se confirmó que los detenidos forman parte de la banda que amagó, amenazó y asaltó el domicilio del [cantante, actor y productor. ](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miguel_Bos%C3%A9) Según la información oficial, los probables implicados son de nacionalidad extranjera, dijo Pablo Vázquez, secretario de Seguridad capitalina. SON LOS LADRONES de la CASA de MIGUEL BOSÉ.— Carlos Jiménez (@c4jimenez) Los tipos sometidos así en Periférico, son colombianos. Forman parte d una banda d ladrones de casas q opera en [@AlcaldiaAO] [@AlcCuajimalpa]y 8 estados. Agentes d Inteligencia d [@SSC_CDMX]llevaban meses siguiéndolos. Atracaron a M. Bosé. [pic.twitter.com/PcSF6GNIod] [December 29, 2023] ¿CUÁNDO ASALTARON A MIGUEL BOSÉ? El asalto a la residencia de la estrella española sucedió en agosto en la Alcaldía Álvaro Obregón, en donde amagaron a él, a sus hijos y personal que trabaja con ellos para quitarle joyas, dinero en efectivo y una camioneta tipo Suburban. Tras el operativo de captura del jueves, se detalló que los dos hombres detenidos de nacional colombiana responden a los nombres de Rolando López Hernández y/o Juan Leonardo, señalado de que cambiaba constantemente de residencia en domicilios ubicados en el Estado de México y las alcaldías [ Miguel Hidalgo y Venustiano Carranza.](https://vanguardia.com.mx/show/asegura-people-en-espanol-que-vecinos-vinculan-a-ines-gomez-mont-en-asalto-a-miguel-bose-FL9195744) Además, se identificó también a Joel Steven Reyes Tamayo, también originario de Colombia. De acuerdo a Milenio, quien ingresó a la residencia en un vehículo BMW y el cual mantuvo comunicación constante con Rolando durante el robo además reportaron su escape por calles de las alcaldías Magdalena Contreras y Álvaro Obregón. — SSC CDMX (@SSC_CDMX) [#ConferenciaDePrensa]l Continuando con el seguimiento, policías de la [#CDMX]identificaron un vehículo de alta gama color negro tripulado por Edward Jadir “N” y/o Ernesto “N”, Fernando “N” y Manuel Antonio “N”, en inmediaciones de anillo [#Periférico], alcaldía [@ALaMagdalenaC]... [December 29, 2023] TE PUEDE INTERESAR: [¡Muggle tenía que ser! Gary Oldman confiesa no haberle gustado su trabajo en ‘Harry Potter’](https://vanguardia.com.mx/show/muggle-tenia-que-ser-gary-oldman-confiesa-no-haberle-gustado-su-trabajo-en-harry-potter-FN10596982) ¿QUÉ DIJO MIGUEL BOSÉ? La denuncia de Bosé la realizó tan sólo unos días después de la tragedia que expuso y atacó su círculo personal. “Se están diciendo cosas que no son ciertas, como habitualmente gustan. Gracias a todos por el apoyo y preocupación constante demostrada, pero quedad tranquilos. A mis vecinos de urbanización, los primeros en llegar, mil gracias de todo corazón”, comentó en su momento el excoach de La Voz México. También se dio a conocer de manera oficial que la banda criminal capturada en Periférico de CDMX opera en zonas de alta plusvalía en la Ciudad de México, así como Veracruz, Puebla, Guanajuato, Estado de México, Jalisco y Nuevo León.

author: Andrew Manis
title: Evangelicals and a happy new Year – Baptist News Global
text: ’Twas the night before the night before Christmas and the preacher was being stirred by the memory of a childhood experience. Walking down the street, listening to his transistor radio playing the holiday classic “Snoopy’s Christmas.” This merry little Christmas song told of Snoopy piloting his World War I airplane against his dreaded foe, the Red Baron. Fighting fiercely, Snoopy realized he had ice on his wings (it was 40-below) and as the Red Baron flew closer, Snoopy was sure he was a goner. But the Baron’s machine gun went silent. Instead, he forced Snoopy to land behind enemy lines. When the Red Baron landed, again Snoopy “was certain that this was the end.” Instead, the Baron called out, “Merry Christmas, mein friend.” The “enemies” drank a toast and flew off to fight another day. And why? The Red Baron apparently heard the chorus: Christmas bells, those Christmas bells Ringing through the land Bringing peace to all the world And good will to man. And the little transistor radio boy felt tears on his cheeks and goosebumps on his arms. That little boy has now lived through 13 presidents and worries about shooting wars in Ukraine and Israel and the almost as deadly culture wars in the United States. But nobody is bringing peace to these three points on the globe. Nothing I do or say or write is likely to change anything among the Russians, Ukrainians, Israelis or with Hamas. But here in America, who knows. So I’ll cast my bread upon the waters, and as Mr. Trump frequently says, “We’ll see what happens.” Our culture wars first will be fought in the courts determining whether 45 will go to jail, gets bounced from ballots in states in addition to Colorado or becomes 47. Then it will be fought among the voters. If he wins, he’s already promised to be a dictator on the first day. If he can do it on Day One, what’s to stop him from doing it on Day 2 or 100 or 1,000 (2.7 years) or 10,000 (27.4 years)? And what will this “God-anointed” dictator do in a fascist Amerikan Reich? No prophets (fore-tellers) needed here. But of prophets who tell forth the truth to power we have great need. Indeed, our life as a Democratic Republic depends upon it. Somebody must tell our 45ers, especially the evangelicals who make up his base, and Baptists who are the largest piece of the demographic pie, that King Donald I will bring retribution to millions of us who oppose him or throw his political opponents in jail. Somebody must tell them he will slam the gates against immigrants, separate children from their parents and put them in cages. He will do it despite the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, which the U.S. signed in 1948 and which states: Everyone is entitled to all the rights and freedoms set forth in this declaration, without distinction of any kind, such as race, color, sex, language, religion, political or other opinion, national or social origin. … Everyone has the right to freedom of movement and residence within the borders of each state. Everyone has the right to seek and to enjoy in other countries asylum from persecution. … No one shall be arbitrarily deprived of his nationality nor denied the right to change his nationality. More importantly, somebody must tell them the Lord God instructed the Israelites, “When a foreigner resides among you …, do not mistreat them. The foreigner residing among you must be treated as your native-born. Love them as yourself, for you were once foreigners in Egypt.” Somebody must tell 45 that no president should pardon convicted “patriots” who participated in an insurrection against the United States and endangered members of Congress and the vice president of their own party. “We must stop this Reign of Error.” Somebody must tell them that a president of the United States must have at least enough ethics not to taunt the disabled or disrespect citizens who reject his antidemocratic echoes of the worst dictator in the history of the world. Or not to speak of the Jews as “vermin” who were “poisoning the blood of our country” — language straight out of Mein Kampf, that led to the murder of 6 million Jews in Nazi concentration camps. Someone must tell them that we should not elect a convicted rapist or someone who thinks grabbing women by their genitalia is acceptable. One could go on and on. But we may finally be forced literally to fight a culture war on American streets and sooner than you think. Forty-five must not only be stopped from becoming 47, but he must also be stopped from becoming the Republican nominee. Because he’s proved he won’t play by the rules set up by the Constitution that he has suggested suspending. If he is the nominee again, once again he will refuse to accept the results of any election he does not win. Once again, he will try to steal the general election by force. He will call his violent supporters again to Washington to fight the true patriots who honor the plain meaning of the Constitution. Friends, we stand to lose the greatest democracy in the history of the world. We must stop this Reign of Error. American evangelicals, who are the bulk of his base and who put him in the White House, must come to their senses and reject him. And Baptists, who make up a large part of his evangelical base, must go back and read the Bible. Because any way you read it, whether errant or inerrant, the plain, literal meaning of the Bible demands that we reject this nihilist in Christian clothing who is morally unworthy of the office. May American Snoopies reconcile with our own Red Barons. Maybe then those Christmas bells will ring in a hopeful new year and bring peace and goodwill back to our corner of the world. Andrew M. Manis is emeritus professor of history at Middle Georgia State University and author of A Fire You Can’t Put Out: The Civil Rights Life of Birmingham’s Rev. Fred Shuttlesworth. He is currently working with Mark V. Puroshotham, producer and director of Mercy Pictures, on a documentary based on the book. Learn more about that project by emailing [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#3b564d4b7b565e4958424b52584f4e495e481554495c). Related articles: [One thing that must happen in 2024](https://baptistnews.com/article/one-thing-that-must-happen-in-2024/) | Opinion by Mark Wingfield [Most Americans believe democracy is at risk in 2024 — but for different reasons ](https://baptistnews.com/article/most-americans-believe-democracy-is-at-risk-in-2024-but-for-different-reasons/) [The death and resurrection of Donald Trump: A warning](https://baptistnews.com/article/the-death-and-resurrection-of-donald-trump-a-warning/) | Opinion by Brandan Robertson [A call for immoderate mediators: David Gushee defends democracy from its Christian enemies](https://baptistnews.com/article/a-call-for-immoderate-mediators-david-gushee-defends-democracy-from-its-christian-enemies/) | Analysis by Alan Bean

author: fuxingshuai
title: 植树活动掀热潮 齐鲁大地添"绿装"_山东新闻_大众网
text:
中国新闻网
正值3月12日植树节，山东多地掀起植树热潮，济南、菏泽、临沂、潍坊等地随处可见植树造林的忙碌身影。民众挥锹铲土、扶苗填坑、提水浇灌，种下棵棵树苗，不仅为生态环境增添绿色，也体验了一堂堂生动的环保课。
菏泽市巨野县教育和体育局组织开展“深耕生态教育 厚植绿色未来”主题实践活动。巨野县委宣传部供图
当天，临沂市郯城县高峰头镇邀请园林专家联合郯城县育才中学共同举办“植绿护绿·共护美好家园”主题植树活动。来自育才中学的师生代表以及附近民众100余人参加活动，为郯城县地震断裂带遗址公园亿年地质奇观增添生态绿色。
园林专家结合马陵山喀斯特地貌特征，讲解了黑松等耐旱树种的生态价值及科学种植方法。在专业指导下，大家分组栽种山农酥等本地适生树苗500余株。
活动现场还发放《全民义务植树倡议书》，发起“十年树木·百年树人”生态守护计划，号召公众通过认养古树、参与生态监测等方式长期投身绿色事业。
在菏泽市郓城县杨庄集镇马庄村的植树现场，众人一起挥锹铲土、栽种苗木。据了解，杨庄集镇还创新“护绿”举措，由村两委干部、网格员等分片包干，为每棵树建立“健康档案”，定期检查生长状况。
放眼望去，马庄村村北生产路上，800余株樱花树正酝酿着粉白色的花潮，400余棵白皮松巍然挺立，新栽的苗木在春风中轻轻摇曳，勾勒出一条“车行碧波上，人在画中游”的生态廊道。
在菏泽市鄄城县富春镇尧陵植树现场，民众在挥锹培土。鄄城县委宣传部
“十年树木，百年树人。我和同学们约好了，十年后，我们要再来看望这些‘生态卫士’！”在菏泽市鄄城县富春镇尧陵植树现场，高二学生闫乐与同学们合力栽下6棵国槐后，郑重系上“青春守护承诺卡”。一望无垠的黄河生态廊道上，新栽的苗木正迎风舒展嫩芽。
“目前，我们抢抓春季造林有利时机，高标准、高规格、大力度开展造林绿化行动，充分利用村头荒、道路旁、边角地等植树造林。”鄄城县自然资源局局长李文建介绍，该县广泛发动农村民众在街头巷尾、房前屋后、废弃宅基地栽植绿化树苗，实现生态效益与庭院经济双赢。
济南市莱芜区汶源学校组织学生到雪野街道清宁小镇开展了一场别开生面的植树节活动。
学生们或两两一组，或三人成团，分工明确，配合默契。有的负责紧握铁锹，奋力挖土；有的小心翼翼地将树苗扶正，还不忘叮嘱小伙伴“慢点，别碰伤树苗啦”；还有的细心地为树苗填土，轻轻拍实，确保它能稳稳扎根。
学生们还亲手制作了精美的心愿卡。“愿你茁壮成长，为校园撑起一片绿伞”“希望你能早日枝繁叶茂，让鸟儿有个温馨的家”……一张张心愿卡系在树苗枝头，随风飘动，承载着学生们对小树苗的美好祝愿。
菏泽市单县东城街道举行以“小手拉大手，共植一片绿”为主题的儿童植树节活动。单县县委宣传部供图
当天，在菏泽市单县东城街道，一场以“小手拉大手，共植一片绿”为主题的儿童植树节活动正在举行。40余名小朋友和家长一起，在绿禾庄园种下40余棵树苗，为城市增添了一抹新绿。
小朋友们在家长的帮助下，挥锹铲土、扶苗填坑、浇水灌溉。经过一番辛勤劳动，一棵棵小树苗迎风挺立，为初春的大地增添勃勃生机。“这是我第一次植树，我觉得非常有意义，我要和小树一起成长，以后每年都来看它！”参与植树的小朋友丁芃硕兴奋地说。
第47个植树节来临之际，菏泽市巨野县教育和体育局组织该县中小学幼儿园开展“深耕生态教育厚植绿色未来”主题实践活动，通过“理论+实践”双轨并行模式，引导师生共植生态理念，共建绿色家园。
巨野县金山中学创新开展“果树认养计划”。120名学生在校园劳动实践基地种下了樱桃、苹果等经济林果并挂牌认养，既美化环境，又为未来劳动教育课程储备资源。
在潍坊滨海经济技术开发区，企事业干部职工500余人参加义务植树活动，共种植文冠果1000余棵。植树现场一片繁忙，职工们分工明确，扛苗散苗、挖坑护苗、培土浇水，共同为城市增添新绿。
据了解，潍坊滨海经济技术开发区今年组织街道、园区、村庄、学校、企业积极开展植树、森林抚育等各种义务植树活动，设置植树点30余个，开展义务植树、森林抚育50余次，吸引3000余人次参与。
责编：
审核：付兴帅
责编：付兴帅

author: Colaboração para Universa*
title: Vai viajar? Veja vibradores e sex toys pequenos para levar na mala
text:
Uma viagem com o par pode ser aquele toque que faltava para apimentar a vida sexual. Longe da rotina, vale a pena testar coisas novas —desde posições até manobras para melhorar o prazer. Da mesma forma, fazer uma "trip" sozinha não é motivo para deixar os orgasmos de lado. Pensando nisso, que tal turbinar a mala com vibradores e outros sex toys fáceis de levar?
Modelos discretos, pequenos, mas muito poderosos podem fazer toda a diferença na vida sexual. A chave é saber escolher com base naquilo de que você gosta mais. De sugadores de clitóris a bullets, a diversão está garantida com a nossa seleção de modelos. Vem ver!
Bullet O nome desse tipo de vibrador é inspirado em seu formato semelhante ao de uma bala. Pequeno e discreto, ele é ideal para estimular o clitóris pelo lado de fora. Pode ser usado tanto para masturbação —sozinha ou acompanhada— ou na hora da penetração, ao segurá-lo próximo ao clitóris, aumentando a intensidade do prazer. Pequeno e discreto, você pode levar esse vibrador até na mala de mão —sem risco de pagar por volume extra.
Milly Lacombe
Urbanista alerta para os riscos do novo Pacaembu
Sakamoto
Tiro à queima-roupa em SP é cena trágica e inaceitável
Casagrande
Marcelo no Flu foi como Dani Alves no São Paulo

Por que tantas mulheres odeiam futebol
Vibrador controlado por aplicativo O celular tira foto, acessa as redes sociais, troca mensagens e? Controla o sex toy! Pequenos e acionados por aplicativos, esses modelos prometem tornar a diversão garantida até a distância. Com o aplicativo, você pode controlar o seu prazer pelo seu celular ou convidar alguém, mesmo que essa pessoa esteja em outro lugar, para controlar para você.
Design diferenciado Os sex toys não precisam ter o mesmo modelo sempre. Alguns designs diferenciados, bem distantes daquelas formas fálicas, vão passar despercebidos em sua mala de viagem. Tem brinquedo que pode ser posicionado em cima da roupa com um ímã, tem em formato de batom, de coelho e até de polvo. Vale estimular a criatividade — e outras coisas mais!
Sugador de clitóris Resumindo: simulador de sexo oral. Essa é a principal função deste sex toy. Ou seja: orgasmos garantidos (e em tempo recorde). Você pode usá-lo como estimulador clitoriano, durante a pentração ou masturbação, ou como o sugador, que simula o sexo oral. Também tem sugadores com vibrador, sendo uma promessa de orgasmos potentes. Escolha o que mais te atrai e mande ver.
Continua após a publicidade Relacionadas Vibrador, bullet ou sugador? Saiba como escolher o sex toy ideal para você Mais prazer, tremor, efeito hidratante: quais são os lubrificantes da moda? Sugadores de clitóris: melhor do que muito boy por aí Anel peniano Esse sex toy cabe em qualquer necessaire. Flexível e capaz de se adaptar a todos os formatos de pênis, ele ajuda a manter a ereção por mais tempo enquanto estimula o clitóris na hora de penetração. Só sucesso.
Plug anal O que vale é sentir prazer —mesmo que seja em áreas que você não costuma estimular (ou que não experimentou ainda). Toys para serem usados na região anal têm ergonomia específica para a região. Mais do que apenas penetrar: alguns também vibram. Há modelos que funcionam com o uso de controle remoto e podem ser usado por iniciantes nesse tipo de estímulo.
*Com matéria publicada em 21/01/2022

author: www.yunnan.cn,云南日报报业集团,云南网
title: 造林种草767万公顷！2024年我国显著增绿_国内_新闻频道_云南网
text:
原标题：造林种草767万公顷！2024年我国显著增绿
今年3月12日是我国第47个植树节。全国绿化委员会办公室当天发布的2024年中国国土绿化状况公报显示，2024年全国完成营造林444.6万公顷、种草改良322.4万公顷、治理沙化石漠化土地278.3万公顷，森林覆盖率超25%，森林蓄积量超200亿立方米。
2024年，全民义务植树深入推进，线上线下活动蓬勃开展。我国全年发布各类尽责活动6.1万个，建成“互联网+全民义务植树”基地2600余个，为适龄公民就近、适时、多样尽责提供服务。
一年来，“三北”工程攻坚战迈出坚实步伐。聚焦打好三大标志性战役，完成治理面积超380万公顷。
城乡绿化美化水平持续提升。开工建设“口袋公园”6200余个，建设城市绿道7300余公里。
通过持续深化改革，生态富民产业实现提质增效。公报显示，2024年全年林草产业总产值10.17万亿元，同比增长9.6%，森林食物产量超2亿吨，成为继粮食、蔬菜之后的第三大重要农产品。全国经济林种植面积4666.7万公顷、年产值超2万亿元，林下经济利用林地面积4000万公顷、年产值约1万亿元。生态旅游游客量达27.6亿人次，同比增长9.1%。（记者 胡璐）

author: Click4r Solutions Private Limited
title: Benefits of Low-Maintenance Artificial Turf in Houston | Click4R
text: Houston is a busy city, making lawn care difficult. A perfect yard is hard to achieve in the hot climate, frequent droughts, and water restrictions. However, homeowners and businesses are increasingly using artificial turf. Low maintenance and cost savings are among the benefits of this innovative landscaping option. This blog discusses Houston artificial turf installation benefits and costs. Houston lawns: why use artificial turf? Artificial turf is popular with homeowners and businesses due to its low maintenance. Artificial turf requires less watering, mowing, fertilizing, and weeding than natural grass. You can enjoy a lush lawn year-round without the hassle of maintenance. In Houston, where water conservation is important, artificial turf is eco-friendly. Natural grass lawns use a lot of water, especially in summer. By using artificial turf, you can conserve water and lower your water bills. Artificial turf can withstand heavy use and bad weather. Despite the weather, it stays green and vibrant. It's ideal for playgrounds, sports fields, and commercial spaces due to its durability. With proper care, artificial turf can last 15 years or more, making it a good long-term investment. Artificial turf Houston cost more to install, but it saves money over time. Watering, mowing, fertilizing, and pest control are ongoing costs with natural grass. Instead, artificial turf eliminates these costs, saving money over time. Understanding Houston Artificial Turf Cost Houston turf artificial installation costs depend on area size, turf type, and installation complexity. Professional installation costs $8–15 per square foot on average. This price covers materials, labor, and site preparation. The cost of artificial turf depends on its quality. High-quality turf is more durable and attractive, but it costs more. Choose a reliable supplier like go-turf for high-quality, affordable products. Padding for comfort, antimicrobial treatments to prevent odors and bacteria, and UV protection to prevent fading can also affect artificial turf prices. These features extend turf life and functionality, making them worthwhile investments for those seeking maximum benefits. Artificial turf is low-maintenance, but there are ongoing costs. Periodic cleaning, brushing to maintain the turf's appearance, and inspections for minor repairs are examples. However, these costs are much lower than natural grass maintenance. You must consider your needs and preferences when choosing artificial turf for your Houston property. Consider these factors: Choosing a pet-friendly, heavy-use turf may be best if you have pets or children. For sports field turf, choose a product with good traction and durability. Artificial turf has different textures, pile heights, and greens. Choose a product that mimics natural grass and matches your landscape. High-quality turf should look and feel real. Choose recycled, chemical-free products. These products protect your family and pets and the environment. Houston residents trust go-turf for the best artificial turf. Go-turf offers a variety of premium turf products for different needs and budgets with a focus on quality and customer satisfaction. Their experts can help you choose and install to ensure a smooth experience. Transform Your Lawn! Ready to transform your lawn with high-quality artificial turf? Contact go-turf today for a free consultation and estimate. With their expertise and high-quality products, you can have a beautiful, low-maintenance lawn that boosts property value. Start your greener, more sustainable future with go-turf today. In Houston homeowners and businesses should consider artificial turf for a lush, green lawn without the hassle and high cost of natural grass. Knowing what factors affect artificial turf Houston cost can help you choose a product that fits your needs and budget. You can have a beautiful, durable, and eco-friendly lawn for years with the right product and professional installation.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Best men’s knitwear 2024, from cardigans to cashmere
text: As the song goes: “Baby, it’s cold outside,” so, it’s time to stock up on the best men ’s knitwear to counteract the British winter weather. Finding the right fit for your knitwear is the first step – do you prefer an oversized look or a more fitted style for layering? Mock neck or crew neck? Boxy or true to size? Knitwear is the perfect way to inject some personality into your wardrobe this season, so try opting for something out of your comfort zone: whether that’s an oversized fit, a new texture or something with a bold colour. We have gathered a variety of styles so you’ve got lots of options for bundling up during the colder months. Whatever your style, we have been layering up for winter with a range of knits to find the best options for men this season. From statement patterned knits and slogan pieces, to fluffy mohair styles and carbon-negative pullovers, you are sure to find the perfect style. We’ve been building winter outfits around these knits for weeks, making sure each and every one is stylish, cosy and good value. From more-affordable knits from high-street shops such as Uniqlo, Mango and H&M to independent British knitwear makers such as Hades and investment cashmere piece, all of these knits come highly recommended.
